cab.content: SECRET. BATTLE SITUATION - MIDDAY z 6th APRIL. 1918, NORTH OF THE SOMHB. There have been no fresh German attacks, We have retaken a portion of the ground lost yesterday, but the villages of BUCQUOY and HAMEL are in enemy hands. We have pressed the enemy back North of DERNANCOURT, but he still holds the village. Further information shows that the attacks yesterday were made by at least 9 or 10 Divisions which lost heavily. Our 47th, 42nd & 4th Australian Divisions suffered consid- erably. -2e SOUTH OF THE SOMHS. Enemy attempts this morning to advance from HAMEL were broken by artillery fire. 3. FRENCH FROST * No further developments, but an enemy attack is expected to-day between HANGARD and DORMART*General Staff, War Office, S.S *1. 6th April, 1918.Issued at 1.10 p*m.
